title: Smooth Sweet Tea Recipe
description: This sweet tea is a classic Southern drink served chilled and easily made with tea bags and sugar for a great way to cool down on a hot summer day.

Original recipe (1X) yields 7 servings 1 pinch baking soda 2 cups boiling water 6 tea bags ¾ cup white sugar 6 cups cool water Directions Gather ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Sprinkle a pinch of baking soda into a 64-ounce, heat-proof glass pitcher. Pour in boiling water and add tea bags. Cover and allow to steep for 15 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Remove tea bags and discard; stir in sugar until dissolved. Pour in cool water; refrigerate until cold, about 3 hours. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Enjoy! Add Your Photo Photos of Smooth Sweet Tea 01 of 72 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 72 Photo by  CleverSieve4322 08/16/2022 This recipe makes a great baseline though I made some tweaks! I used 2x the boiling water for my tea, and 5 cups ice. I steeped in a teapot, then poured over the ice i put in the pitcher. I think ice works better for ice tea recipes than cool water if you have an ice maker or easy way to get lots of ice. The tea is beautifully clear as you can see, and I thought it had great flavor and the perfect level of sweetness. I usually buy pure leaf sweet tea so that is what I was aiming to replicate :) 03 of 72 Photo by  Amanda N Rogers 07/13/2022 Five stars. I guess all this time I’ve been making iced tea wrong — that solid pinch of baking soda takes off the slight bitterness, and it’s a game changer! This recipe was so simple to follow, and the outcome is terrific. Many thanks. 04 of 72 Photo by  Brittany Hartman 05/18/2020 Oh goodness! Best sweet tea I've had!! I doubled the recipe but only used 1.25c of sugar. Didn't want it to sweet. It was perfect!! 05 of 72 Photo by  Charlotte 03/25/2020 06 of 72 Photo by  harmy1 09/17/2019 Easy, simple, delish, 07 of 72 Photo by  Becky 07/19/2019 This recipe is great! I used 2 cups of lemonade and 4 cups of cold water in place of the 6 cups of water for a different taste. I'll be making this all summer!! 08 of 72 Photo by  Sheila H 06/29/2019 09 of 72 Photo by  Jonathon Richardson 06/25/2019 So good!
